summary: This is a JPMorgan Chase asset account portfolio statement for October 1999 for the entity 'Financial Trust Company, Inc.', showing a portfolio valued at approximately $6.7 million. A key transaction is a wire transfer of $18.3 million to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell, linking Epstein-associated funds to her.

persons.name: Scott/Dencker
persons.context: Listed as the service specialist for the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: A wire transfer of $18.3 million from the account was sent to Bear Stearns 'FAO Ghislaine Maxwell' on October 19, 1999.

connections.description: A substantial wire transfer ($18.3 million) was sent from the Financial Trust Company account to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Wire Transfer to Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: A wire transfer of $18,300,000 was sent from the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account at JPMorgan to Bear Stearns, for the account of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Account Purchase Activity
events.description: A $20,000,000 purchase into the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund was made in the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account.

events.description: A $5,000,000 purchase into the J.P. Morgan Institutional Prime Money Market Fund was made in the Financial Trust Company, Inc. account.

locations: 345 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10154-1002 (JPMorgan address)
6100 Red Hook, Quarters #2, St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands 00802 (Financial Trust Company, Inc. address)
keyFacts: A wire transfer of $18.3 million was sent from a JPMorgan account held by 'Financial Trust Company, Inc.' to Bear Stearns for the benefit of Ghislaine Maxwell on October 19, 1999.
The Financial Trust Company, Inc. account was based in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, a known location for Epstein-associated financial entities.
The account held a portfolio valued at approximately $6.7 million in cash and short-term instruments as of October 31, 1999.
The document is a standard financial statement, but the specific transaction to Maxwell directly links Epstein network funds to a key associate.
The document is marked 'Confidential Treatment Requested by JPMorgan' and is part of the legal discovery process (JPM-SDNY-00036863 etc.).
